intro: Cyclophyllum marquesense, commonly known as the Marquesan cyclophyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Marquesas in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in rocky or coastal vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
